translation1: "Since its introduction in 2001, the Valvetronix series from VOX has constantly evolved, which among other things led to the combination of advanced modeling technology with the \"Valve Reactor\" circuit, which perfectly imitates the behavior of a tube amplifier. With the VT20X/VT40X/VT100X Amps, we are presenting a completely new modeling engine that is absolutely state-of-the-art in terms of sound. Thanks to the VET technology (Virtual Element Technology), which is based on the analysis of components and amp circuits, the VTX amplifiers wait with an authenticity that is absolutely impressive.Also do auch diese Amps den mehrstufigen Valvetronix-Röhrenvorverstärker enthalten. Dieser beruht teilweise auf echten analogen Schaltungen, weil diese die Klangvariationen und Nuancen eines Röhrenverstärkers einfach besser hinbekommen als jede Simulation. Zusätzlich zu dieser ausgeklügelten Schaltung bieten die VTX-Verstärker ein geschlossenes Gehäuse und ein Bassreflexsystem, aus dem die natürlichen Resonanzen nur so sprudeln.With the \"Tone Room\" software from VOX, you can even correct and bend historical facts on the virtual level, so that the amp and effects sound exactly as you have always imagined it. The perfect combination of tube sound with modeling technology is mainly due to the 2001 introduced VOX Valve Reactor technology. Of course, it has been refined several times since then to meet new sound requirements, which led to another performance boost of the VOX Valvetronix series in 2010 - with more dynamics as well as numerous and significantly improved amplifier models.From the handy VT20+ to the VT120+ with two speakers, the new VT+ Valvetronix series has been designed in such a way that all guitarists looking for maximum sound diversity will find what they're looking for. All guitarists dream of the compression and dynamics of a tube amplifier: they expect a fat sound, nuanced reproduction of playing dynamics and string attack, as well as prompt response. During a detailed analysis, VOX engineers discovered that the final stage determines the tube character of an amplifier and developed the VOX Valve Reactor technology based on this finding.The valve reactor circuit of each VT+ amplifier perfectly reproduces the behavior, subtle nuances, and sound character of a tube amplifier."
gpt_response: { "Cohesion": { "Lexical Cohesion Mistakes": [ "In the sentence 'Thanks to the VET technology (Virtual Element Technology), which is based on the analysis of components and amp circuits, the VTX amplifiers wait with an authenticity that is absolutely impressive.', the phrase 'wait with an authenticity' is incorrect and does not make sense in context. It's possible the correct phrase is 'provide an authenticity.'", "The sentence 'Also do auch diese Amps den mehrstufigen Valvetronix-Röhrenvorverstärker enthalten.' is in German and thus disrupts the flow of the text." ], "Grammatical Cohesion Mistakes": [ "In the sentence 'With the VT20X/VT40X/VT100X Amps, we are presenting a completely new modeling engine that is absolutely state-of-the-art in terms of sound.', the pronoun 'we' is introduced without a clear antecedent.", "In the sentence 'With the \"Tone Room\" software from VOX, you can even correct and bend historical facts on the virtual level, so that the amp and effects sound exactly as you have always imagined it.', the pronoun 'it' lacks clarity. It's unclear whether 'it' refers to the amplifier, effects, or both.", "In the sentence 'This beruht partially on real analog circuits, because this the sound variations and nuances of a tube amplifier better than any simulation.', 'This' is used as a pronoun without a clear antecedent and 'beruht' is not a word in the English language.", "In the sentence 'During a detailed analysis, VOX engineers discovered that the final stage determines the tube character of an amplifier and developed the VOX Valve Reactor technology based on this finding.', there's a slight confusion in the structure of the sentence. It's unclear whether 'VOX engineers' is the subject for both 'discovered' and 'developed', even though the meanings of the two clauses are related."] } }
reference: Since its introduction in 2001, the Valvetronix series from VOX has continuously been improved, which has lead to, among other things, the combination of groundbreaking modeling technology with the “Valve Reactor” circuit with which the behavior of a tube amplifies is perfectly reproduced. With the VT20X/VT40X/VT100X amps, we present a brand-new modeling engine, which is the absolute state-of-the-art in the field of sound. Thanks to VET technology (Virtual Element Technology), which utilizes an analysis of the components and amp circuits, the VTX amplifier puts forth an authenticity, which is absolutely impressive. These amps also include the multi-leveled Valvetronix tube amplifiers, of course. This deals with real analogue circuits, because these simply are better than any simulation at obtaining the sound variations and nuances of a tube amplifier. In addition to this sophisticated circuitry, the VTX amplifier offers a closed casing and bass reflex system, from which natural resonances just burst out. With VOX’s “Tone Room” software, you can even correct and bend historical facts on a virtual plane until the amp and the effects sound just like you have always imagined them. The perfect combination of tube sound with modeling technology is above all thanks to the VOX valve reactor technology introduced in 2001. Naturally, it has been refined ever since then in order to handle new sound requirements, which in 2010 lead to a renewed power boost to the VOX Valvetronix series with more dynamics as well as numerous, decisively improved amplifier models. From the handy VT20+ to the VT120+ with two speakers, the new VT+ Valvetronix series has additionally been designed in such a way that all guitarists looking for maximum sound variety will find what they need here. All guitarists dream of the pressure and the dynamics of a tube amp: They want a fat sound, a nuanced playback of playing dynamics and chord strokes, as well as a prompt response. During an in-depth analysis the VOX engineers discovered that the output stage above all else determines the tube character of an amplifier and they developed the VOX Valve reactor technology on the basis of this discovery. The Valve reactor circuit of any VT+ amplifier equipped with a 12AX7 tube produces the character, the subtle nuances and the sound shape of a tube amplifier perfectly.

translation1: "Basketball Bundesliga: Debacle of MHP Riesen Ludwigsburg against Merlins Crailsheim At least Johannes Patrick was left. Again nothing: For the second time within less than three months, the Riesen lost in Crailsheim - and how!Before the game, Ludwigsburg's coach John Patrick looked back on the cup defeat in October at the Hakro Merlins Crailsheim and said: \"We still have some anger in our stomach.\" But this anger did not subside after the game - on the contrary, it was further fueled by the 61:72 (28:38) defeat in the Basketball Bundesliga. What was more disappointing than the bare result was the way the team performed.A substitute statistic is named, which expresses the entire dilemma: The triple quote amounted to just 13 percent, 4 goals (all scored by young Johannes Patrick) in 31 attempts - more questions? The answer was provided by John Patrick: \"We were not concentrated enough after our victory in Tenerife and did not implement what we had trained for, namely moving the ball.\"The reaction of his counterpart Sebastian Gleim was completely different: \"It was a great game to win for the second time against Ludwigsburg,\" said the happy coach. \"It felt like playing in front of 10,000 people.\" There were only 750 spectators in the Hohenlohe Arena on Saturday, but they made the most of it.Not least because of BBL top scorer T.J. Shorts, who marked 22 points and led his team's play. \"The best playmaker I have ever trained,\" praised Gleim. While Patrick's team's key performers, such as Jordan Hulls (0 points) and Jonah Radebaugh (7), failed throughout the line.Only in the last quarter (22:15) did the giants prevent a total disaster and came within eight points, after they had already trailed by 39:59. Besides Johannes Patrick, Justin Simon also scored 12 points. Fortunately, there was plenty of time left for discussion.Already on Wednesday (7:00 PM), the giants receive the Skyliners Frankfurt, with a maximum of 750 spectators in Ludwigsburg before then."

      "The term 'substitute statistic' is less clear than 'a statistic was given' from the reference text.",
      "The phrase 'triple quote' should be 'triple quota' as in the reference text to maintain cohesion.",
      "The term 'goals' should be 'hits' to stay consistent with the reference text's terminology.",
      "The term 'playmaker' does not match the reference text's term 'top shooter' and alters the meaning slightly."
    ],
    "Grammatical Cohesion Mistakes": [
      "There is inconsistent tense usage in 'the Riesen lost' as compared to 'the Giants lost' in the reference text.",
      "Using 'completely different' instead of 'much differently' slightly changes the nuance in comparison to the reference text.",
      "The use of 'marked 22 points' instead of 'landed 22 points' does not maintain the same descriptive consistency.",

    ]
  }
}

reference: National basket ball league: Derby-Debakel, MHP Ludwigsburg Giants at Merlins Crailsheim At least the youngster Johannes Patrick was reliable. Nothing, again: For the second time within less than three months the Giants lost in Crailsheim - and how! John Patrick, the trainer for Ludwigsburg, said before the game in reference to the previous finals loss in the beginning of October to HAKRO Crailsheim Merlins that: “We are still angry about it”. But this was note put to rest after the game, but rather it increased once again after the 61-72 (28-38) defeat in the basketball league. It wasn’t just the score that was disappointing, but also the way they showed up. A statistic was given for this which expresses the whole dilemma: The triple quota was only 13 percent, 4 hits (all from the young Johannes Patrick) and a whopping 31 attempts - any questions? The answer was given by John Patrick: “We were simply not concentrated enough after the victory at Teneriffa and we didn’t put into practice what we had trained.” They just didn’t move the ball. His counterpart Sebastian Gleim reacted much differently: “It was an awesome game winning for the second time against Ludwigsburg,” the happy coach said. “It felt like it was in front of 10,000 people.” 750 people were let into the Hohenlohe Arena on Saturday, and they got what they paid for. Not least of all because of the BBL top shooter T.J. Shorts, who landed 22 pointes and steered the game for his team. “The best player, who I have ever trained,“ said Gleim in praise. While at the same time on Patricks Team even the top performers like Jordan Hulls (0 points) and Jonah Radebaugh (7) failed when they got to the line. Only in the last quarter (22:15) did the giants prevent a total debacle and came within eight points, after which they were knocked back down to 39:59. Not just Johannes Patrick but Justin Simon also scored twelve points. There was luckily not a lot of time to fight. On Wednesday (7 PM) the giants will already host Skyliners Frankfurt in front of a maximum of 750 spectators in Ludwigsburg.

translation1: "In the name of the people: Laypeople sit in everyday clothes on the judge's bench in the courtroom. But a lot depends on their judgment, even if they don't wear a robe: Jurors decide with professional judges whether and for how long someone will go behind bars.Two of them report in a conversation with the \"Public\" about their time at the Bad Kreuznacher Landgericht: Sascha Wickert from Boos and Ruth Ertz from Bad Kreuznach are two of a total of 125 lay judges at the Landgericht at John-F.-Kennedy-Straße."
reference: In the name of the people: Lay people give out judgement They are sitting in everyday clothes at the judge’s bank in the courthouse. A lot is depending on their decision, even if they are not wearing robes: Jurors are determining with professional judges if and for how long someone is behind bars. Two of them are reporting in a conversation with the “Oeffentlichen” about their time at the Bad Kreuznacher regional court: Sascha Wickert from Boos and Ruth Ertz from Bad Kreuznach are two of a total of 125 lay judges of the district court on John F. Kennedy Street.

translation1: "I am frustrated with Sky Sport F1 Hello dear F1 fans, the quality on the German Sky has decreased significantly throughout the season, so I want to vent a bit with this post. Firstly, the transmission was interrupted during the F2 race to ensure punctual F1 coverage.Although the schedule was significantly behind due to the delayed start and the crash at the beginning, it would still have been possible to show the last (planned) ten minutes as well as the championship decision. However, it seems that for legal reasons, F1 has priority and everything else has to be restricted, so Sky DE probably had no choice. Sky UK, on the other hand, broadcast the race until the end.Despite a small compliment: the commentator Olivier Zwartjes has accompanied the difficult situation around the heavy accident well. Then there was again a rule incompetence among the commentators Sascha Roos and Ralf Schumacher, so both did not know that you can change tires under a red flag. Although this situation occurred in Imola, Baku and Silverstone this year, both only came to the decision that Verstappen can change tires when there were corresponding radio messages to this topic to Hamilton.At Sky UK and RTL, both commentators immediately knew that there is a possibility for Verstappen. I believe that one should simply know such elementary rules when commenting on Formula 1 for a pay-TV broadcaster. It is also not the first riddle regarding what is now allowed or prescribed by the rules, both have simply had constant uncertainties in the topic of rules.Generally, I don't like the artificial commentary style of Roos, but I have to admit that it is a matter of taste. However, I find Heiko Wasser from RTL much better, even though I don't like his constant jokes, which make both of them appear unprofessional, such as ordering coffee at (equally clueless) reporter Peter Hardenacke or \"UuuuuHD\" from Ralf Schumacher.The last one brings total chaos in the commentary, which he apparently does not take seriously. Not least, advertising simply takes over at Sky, and in the final stretch, Sky is the only channel that goes into advertising, as one can hear from F1TV after the race, where only the German soundtrack without commentary is available directly after the race. Neither ServusTV nor ORF do this.Both of these channels make less advertising during their training than Sky, and that as a free TV channel. Although I must praise Glock and Baumgartner for their work, this alone does not allow me to overlook the disadvantages. The rest of the Sky Sport F1 program is also very scarce and full of repeats.Overall, Sky is truly the worst German-speaking broadcaster for Formula 1. Ironically, RTL does a better job with the four races they are still allowed to transmit, except for the advertising. So, at least, the grandiose F1 season makes significantly less fun than it would be with a reasonable broadcaster.I would be interested in your opinion."

      "Using 'However, I find Heiko Wasser from RTL much better' instead of contrasting Heiko Wasser and Roos directly affects the structure and clarity.",
      "Replacing 'cool-down lap' with 'final stretch' changes the specific terminology of F1, affecting cohesion with the reference text's vocabulary."
    ],
    "Grammatical Cohesion Mistakes": [

      "The transition 'Despite a small compliment:' is less cohesive than 'In spite of that, some small praise:' from the reference text because it does not properly link back to the previous criticism.",
      "The sentence 'Then there was again a rule incompetence among the commentators' lacks a bridging conjunction or phrase to connect it cohesively with the previous idea.",
      "The repeated use of 'Sky UK and RTL, both commentators' causes confusion because 'both' is used without clear reference. It should maintain distinction as in the reference text.",

reference: I am annoyed with Sky Sport F1 Hello F1 fans, the quality of German Sky decreased over the course of the season, such that I want to clear it up some with this post. First things first, today the transmission broke off in the middle of the F2 race in order to punctually begin the pre-show reporting of the F1. It was because of the delayed start and the falling accident that the schedule was so far behind what was planned, but you still could have let the last (planned) 10 minutes show as well as the tournament decision (!). Apparently because of legal reasons, F1 has priority and because of that everything else needs to be restricted such that Sky Germany didn’t really have a choice here. It is still dumb, because Sky UK transmitted the race up until the very end. In spite of that, some small praise: the announcer Olivier Zwartyes was a good accompaniment to the difficult situation and the unfortunate accident. In the F1 there was even knowledge gaps of the rules in the commentary by Sascha Roos and Ralf Schumacher, both of them didn’t know that during a red flag the tires are allowed to be changed. Although this situation already came up this year in Imola, Baku and Silverstone, they both first came to the conclusion that Verstappen was allowed to switch his tires following corresponding radio messages on the topic to Hamilton. The announcers at Sky UK and RTL knew immediately that this was a possibility for Verstappen. I am of the opinion that knowledge of such elementary rules should be assumed if you are going to provide F1 commentary on a paid-for TV broadcaster. It's also not the first guessing game as to what is possible or required by the rules, both of them have constant uncertainties regarding rules. In general I don’t really like the artificial style of the commentary from Roos, but I’ll admit that is a manner of taste. But even Heiko Wasser from RTL does it better in my honest opinion. Additionally, there are just absurdities, which make the two of them seem unprofessional, like the ordering of coffee with the (just as clueless) reporter Peter Hardenacke or the “Ahhhh HD” from Ralf Schumacher. This last part really brings a lot of agitation into the commentary which he doesn’t take seriously. Not least of all, the advertising is just so prevalent on Sky, in the cool-down lap Sky is the only broadcaster that still goes to commercials, like you can hear this on F1TV, because only the German audio track comes out without commentary right after the race. Neither ServusTV nor ORF do this. Both of these broadcasters also do less commercials than Sky during training, and they are free TV broadcasters. You even have to congratulate Glock and Baumgartner for their work, but that alone doesn’t cause me to overlook the disadvantages. The normal program from Sky Sport F1 is also very sparse and full of repetitions. All in all, Sky is really the worst German-speaking broadcaster that transmits the F1. In all honesty, RTL does a better job of transmitting the four races which they are allowed to transmit, including even the advertisements. At any rate, it really makes the grand F1 season considerably less fun as would be the case with a reasonable broadcaster. I would be really interested in your opinion.
